div.class: inner col col24 first last id0333a6c9-3feb-49c7-b036-6bba120340c3

li.div: Offices Closed April 3rd to May 1st Read on...

h4.a: County Administration Building Closed to Public 3/31/2020

li.div: County Administration Building Closed to Public 3/31/2020 Read on...
Declaration of Local Emergency Read on...

div.class: inner col col24 first last id0cffab5a-04bf-4198-836a-092987fb4f16

div.p: Jackson County Board of Commissioners Chairman Tom Crow signed an order March 18, 2020 declaring a Local Emergency due to the Coronavirus(COVID-19) outbreak. This falls in line with the Presidential and State actions taken declaring this event a national emergency and public health state of emergency. This action is being taken to allow the County to operate as efficiently and effectively as possible in its response to this emergency. UPDATED 4/13/2020 Jackson County Government is closing its offices until 5/1/2020 in order to comply with Executive Order From Governor Brian Kemp issued on 4/2/2020.

Essential functions such as Sheriff operations, E911, EMA, EMS, Senior Citizen meals, and Solid Waste transfer station and compactor sites will continue operations throughout this emergency. Animal Control services will be provided on an emergency basis only.

td.p:
Admin Building CLOSED to Public. Call or visit website:
http://www.jacksoncountygov.com/237/Finance 706-367-6313
Closed to the public until further notice.
Closed to the public until further notice.

Offices closed to the public until further notice; Inspections still running as normal.
http://www.jacksoncountygov.com/159/Building-Inspections
https://energovweb.jacksoncoga.gov/EnerGovProd/SelfService#/home

All filing deadlines for cases in Georgia have been postponed through April 13, 2020.
Listed below are the Vendors we use for E recording Real Estate (Deeds, Plats, Liens and UCCs)
Georgia Superior Court Clerks Cooperative Authority *** gsccca.org *** 800-304-5174
Offices closed to the public until further notice;
Offices closed to the public, but Registration Applications and Absentee Ballot Applications in the mail by a request over the phone.
Septic tank permits and restaurant inspections. Only open for inspector office hours M-F 8am-9:30am until further notice. For help email at: jackson.eh@dph.ga.gov
Offices closed to the public until further notice;
Offices closed to the public until further notice;
Closed to the public until further notice.
Admin Building CLOSED to Public. Call or visit website for service.
Essential matters only involving delinquency and dependency. 706-387-6371
Offices closed to the public until further notice;
Open for filings. Civil Filings *** peachcourt.com 706-387-6246
Call for assistance. Open for filings. No new or renewal weapon permits. Dates extended.
Closed to the public until further notice.
Admin Building CLOSED to Public. Visit website for information.
Closed until further notice; meals are currently being delivered to seniors.

Please contact the Solicitor General’s office or the State Court Judge’s office concerning matters dealing with State Court criminal cases. The phone number for the State Court Judge’s office is 706-387-6346. The phone number for the Solicitor General’s office is 706-387-6331.
The Superior Court Judges will address individually assigned cases that they consider necessary and essential to handle. Superior Civil Filings *** peachcourt.com 706-387-6246

Admin Building CLOSED to Public. Visit website links below for service.
MOTOR VEHICLE WEBSITE: eservices.drives.ga.gov 706-367-6319

Transit services not running until further notice.
http://www.jacksoncountygov.com/363/Transit 706-367-5288

Transfer station and remote collection site still open under normal hours.
http://www.jacksoncountygov.com/344/Solid-Waste 706-367-5253
Offices closed to the public until further notice; For assistance or questions email Toni Harvey at: tharvey@jacksoncountygov.com
